Text

This is bold and this is strong. This is italic and this is emphasized. This is superscript text and this is subscript text. This is underlined and this is code: for (;;) { ... }. Finally, this is a link.

Heading with a Subtitle

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet nullam id egestas urna aliquam

Nunc lacinia ante nunc ac lobortis. Interdum adipiscing gravida odio porttitor sem non mi integer non faucibus ornare mi ut ante amet placerat aliquet. Volutpat eu sed ante lacinia sapien lorem accumsan varius montes viverra nibh in adipiscing blandit tempus accumsan.

Preformatted
i = 0;

while (!deck.isInOrder()) {
  print 'Iteration ' + i;
  deck.shuffle();
  i++;
}

print 'It took ' + i + ' iterations to sort the deck.';

PEPADEN Eco-friendly cardboard tents for music festivals and humanitarian aid http://localhost:4000/ Sun, 19 Feb 2017 17:25:50 +0000 Sun, 19 Feb 2017 17:25:50 +0000 Jekyll v3.3.1 video <p>Having an <strong>embedded media</strong> (photos and video) is often inflexible with a dynamic and <strong>responsive design</strong>.</p> <h3 class="left" id="embed-your-video-like-this">Embed your video like this:</h3> <figure class="highlight"><pre><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><table style="border-spacing: 0"><tbody><tr><td class="gutter gl" style="text-align: right"><pre class="lineno">1 2 3</pre></td><td class="code"><pre><span class="nt">&lt;div</span> <span class="na">class=</span><span class="s">"icontain"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;iframe</span> <span class="na">src=</span><span class="s">"//www.youtube.com/embed/8yis7GzlXNM"</span> <span class="na">allowfullscreen</span><span class="nt">&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;</span> <span class="nt">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="w"> </span></pre></td></tr></tbody></table></code></pre></figure> <p>It’ll play like this funny video below! Try resizing the page!</p> <p>Photo layouts are also really cool and dynamically resizable. Check out the photos/gallery section at <a href="http://magiciansanfrancisco.com">magiciansanfrancisco.com</a> for a demo and see <a href="https://github.com/strongrobert/MagicianSanFrancisco">the source code</a> for how.</p> <div class="icontain"><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/8yis7GzlXNM" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div> Fri, 07 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/07/video.html http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/07/video.html content-other updating <h2 id="updating">Updating</h2> <p>So you’ve got a copy running and there’s some new update? Let’s update!</p> <ol> <li>Checkout your github-pages branch <ul> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">git checkout gh-pages</code> for a standalone or existing page</li> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">git checkout master</code> for a <em>username.github.io</em> page</li> </ul> </li> <li>run <code class="highlighter-rouge">git remote | grep -q "singlepage" || git remote add -t publish singlepage https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged.git</code> to be sure you have access to this repository (you can run this command at any time).</li> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">git fetch singlepage</code> to fetch-in-place new changes.</li> <li>Update to the new base (using merge) <ol> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">git merge singlepage/publish</code></li> </ol> </li> <li>You can alternatively update using rebase. This <em>rewrites history</em> (<strong>bad</strong>), but it is cleaner. <ol> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">git rebase singlepage/publish</code></li> </ol> </li> </ol> Thu, 06 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/06/updating.html http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/06/updating.html content-other usage <p>Alright, you’ve got a clean copy and are ready to push some schmancy pages for the world to ogle at.</p> <ul> <li>Edit <code class="highlighter-rouge">_config.yml</code> to change your title, keywords, and description.</li> <li>Create a new file in <code class="highlighter-rouge">_posts/</code> called <code class="highlighter-rouge">2014-01-01-intro.md</code> Edit it, and add:</li> </ul> <figure class="highlight"><pre><code class="language-text" data-lang="text"><table style="border-spacing: 0"><tbody><tr><td class="gutter gl" style="text-align: right"><pre class="lineno">1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9</pre></td><td class="code"><pre>--- title: "home" bg: white #defined in _config.yml, can use html color like '#010101' color: black #text color style: center --- # Example headline! and so on..<span class="w"> </span></pre></td></tr></tbody></table></code></pre></figure> <ul> <li>Create a second post called <code class="highlighter-rouge">2014-01-02-art.md</code> with an divider image this time:</li> </ul> <figure class="highlight"><pre><code class="language-text" data-lang="text"><table style="border-spacing: 0"><tbody><tr><td class="gutter gl" style="text-align: right"><pre class="lineno">1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8</pre></td><td class="code"><pre>--- title: "Art" bg: turquoise #defined in _config.yml, can use html color like '#0fbfcf' color: white #text color fa-icon: paint-brush --- #### A new section- oh the humanity!<span class="w"> </span></pre></td></tr></tbody></table></code></pre></figure> <p><strong>Note:</strong> That part <code class="highlighter-rouge">fa-icon: paint-brush</code> will use a font-awesome icon of <a href="http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/paint-brush/">paint-brush</a>. You can use any icon from this <a href="http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icons/">font-awesome icon directory</a>.</p> <ul> <li>install Jekyll with <code class="highlighter-rouge">sudo gem install github-pages</code></li> <li>run <code class="highlighter-rouge">jekyll serve -w</code> <ul> <li>visit <a href="http://localhost:4000">localhost:4000</a> to see a live locally served preview.</li> </ul> </li> <li>Push changes and see them live!</li> </ul> <h2 style="margin-top:100px;" id="changing-your-colors"><strong>Changing your colors</strong></h2> <ul> <li>In each post file you can define <code class="highlighter-rouge">bg: mycolor</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">color: myothercolor</code> to change the background and text colors for that section.</li> <li><strong>mycolor</strong> can be a quoted html color like <code class="highlighter-rouge">'#0fbfcf'</code> or a key to a special color defined in <strong>_config.yml</strong> under ‘colors’. <ul> <li><strong>Note:</strong> Changes to _config.yml require a manual restart to your local server with <code class="highlighter-rouge">^C</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">jekyll serve -w</code>.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p>Nifty, right!</p> <h3 style="margin-top:100px;" id="also-see-readmemd-on-githubhttpsgithubcomt413singlepagedusage">Also see <strong>README.md</strong> <a href="https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged#usage"><em>on github!</em></a></h3> Wed, 05 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/05/usage.html http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/05/usage.html content-other setup details <h2 id="setup-as-user-homepage">Setup as user homepage</h2> <ul> <li>Go click <strong>fork</strong> on the <a href="https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged">github project page</a></li> <li>Rename your new repository to <code class="highlighter-rouge">**username**.github.io</code>. (click settings in the right column)</li> <li>Clone your repository, <strong>cd into the project</strong></li> <li>Run <code class="highlighter-rouge">git checkout publish &amp;&amp; git branch -m master &amp;&amp; git push -u origin master &amp;&amp; git branch -D gh-pages</code> to get the <em>publish</em> branch as master for a clean, empty starting point.</li> <li>On your github project page go to <em>settings</em> again and change your <strong>default branch</strong> to <strong><em>master</em></strong></li> <li>Run <code class="highlighter-rouge">git push origin --delete gh-pages</code> to delete your remote’s development branch</li> </ul> <p>Now hop over to <a href="#usage">Usage</a> to get it running with your own stuff!</p> <p><strong>When you publish changes use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git push -u origin master</code></strong></p> <hr /> <h2 id="setup-as-standalone-project-page">Setup as standalone project page</h2> <ul> <li>Go click <strong>fork</strong> on the <a href="https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged">github project page</a></li> <li>Rename your new repository to <code class="highlighter-rouge">whatever you want</code>. (click settings in the right column) <ul> <li>It will go live at yourusername.github.io/<strong>WhateverYouWant</strong></li> </ul> </li> <li>Clone your repository, cd into the project</li> <li>Run <code class="highlighter-rouge">git checkout publish &amp;&amp; git branch -D gh-pages &amp;&amp; git branch -m gh-pages &amp;&amp; git push -uf origin gh-pages</code> to swap the <em>publish</em> and <em>gh-pages</em> branch.</li> </ul> <p>Now hop over to <a href="#usage">Usage</a> to get it running with your own stuff!</p> <p><strong>When you publish changes use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git push -u origin gh-pages</code></strong></p> <hr /> <h2 id="setup-inside-existing-project">Setup inside existing project</h2> <p>This is the most complicated use-case .. but it’s the coolest. Say you’ve got your kickass project <code class="highlighter-rouge">github.com/t413/kicker</code> and want to have some web presence to post about on <a href="http://news.ycombinator.com">hacker news</a>. This will create an orphan branch called <code class="highlighter-rouge">gh_pages</code> in your repository where you can publish changes, posts, images, and such. It won’t alter your code at all.</p> <ul> <li><code class="highlighter-rouge">cd</code> into your project on the command line</li> <li>use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git remote add -t publish singlepage git@github.com:t413/SinglePaged.git</code> to get access to this repository.</li> <li>use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git fetch singlepage publish:gh-pages</code> to fetch the remote branch</li> <li>use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git branch --set-upstream gh-pages singlepage/publish &amp;&amp; git checkout gh-pages;</code> This creates and checks out an orphan branch called gh-pages that tracks the original and lets you make changes.</li> <li>When you run <code class="highlighter-rouge">git push gh-pages:origin/gh-pages</code> it’ll be live at <em>yourusername.github.io/repositoryName</em></li> </ul> <p>Now hop over to <a href="#usage">Usage</a> to get it running with your own stuff!</p> <p><strong>When you publish changes use <code class="highlighter-rouge">git push -u origin gh-pages</code></strong></p> Mon, 03 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/03/details.html http://localhost:4000/content-other/2000/01/03/details.html content-other Why <h4 id="basically">Basically</h4> <h1 id="this-theme-rocks">this theme rocks.</h1> <p>Got some <em>killer app</em>, some <em>neat project</em>, a cool portfolio? Make an easy single-page site to show it all off. SinglePaged uses jekyll niceties to make a <strong><em>polished, modular, and beautiful</em> single page site</strong>.</p> <p>Oh– go see <a href="https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged#fancy-jekyll-powered-single-page-site">some examples</a>!</p> <ul> <li>Each vertical section is a markdown file in <strong>_posts/</strong> directory. <ul> <li>They’re sorted by ‘date’. (we don’t use date anywhere, it only sorts)</li> </ul> </li> <li>Each vertical section sets it’s own <strong>color</strong>, <strong>header icon</strong> (or image), <strong>title</strong>, and easy-to-write markdown body.</li> <li>Only <strong>two things</strong> to edit: <ol> <li>Edit <code class="highlighter-rouge">_config.yml</code> to set the site title, description, etc</li> <li>Add <code class="highlighter-rouge">_posts/*.md</code> to make each vertical section. Copy some examples and add the sections from your README.md for a fast start!</li> </ol> </li> <li>Easy adding of <strong>SEO terms</strong>, <strong>favicon</strong> &amp; such, and <strong>google analytics token</strong>.</li> </ul> <p>Sound good? Let’s go!</p> <p>There are three way to get started: (links jump to that section)</p> <ol> <li>Make a <a href="#setup-as-user-homepage"><strong>user homepage</strong></a> (or organization)</li> <li>Make a <a href="#setup-as-standalone-project-page"><strong>standalone project</strong></a> page</li> <li>Make a <a href="#setup-inside-existing-project">site under an <strong>existing project</strong></a></li> </ol> Sun, 02 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-landing/2000/01/02/why.html http://localhost:4000/content-landing/2000/01/02/why.html content-landing home <h3 class="text-purple" id="whoa-hey-an-open-source"><em>whoa, hey an open-source</em></h3> <p><span class="fa-stack subtlecircle" style="font-size:100px; background:rgba(255,166,0,0.1)"> <i class="fa fa-circle fa-stack-2x text-white"></i> <i class="fa fa-bicycle fa-stack-1x text-orange"></i> </span></p> <h1 class="text-purple" id="single-page-jekyll-theme">single-page jekyll theme</h1> <p>…it’s focused on delivering information quickly, easily, configurably, and stylishly!</p> <p>Want to make a single-page site to show off something cool? Go <a href="https://github.com/t413/SinglePaged">fork me on github!</a></p> <p><span id="forkongithub"> <a href="" class="bg-blue"> Fork me on GitHub </a> </span></p> Sat, 01 Jan 2000 00:00:00 +0000 http://localhost:4000/content-landing/2000/01/01/intro.html http://localhost:4000/content-landing/2000/01/01/intro.html content-landing

Arcue ut vel commodo

} @include breakpoint(medium) { @include padding(10em, 3em); } @include breakpoint(small) { @include padding(5em, 3em); h2 { font-size: 1.25em; margin: 0 0 (_size(element-margin) * 0.5) 0; } } } } body.is-mobile { #main { > header { background-attachment: scroll; } } } /* Footer */ #footer { @include padding(6em, 0); background-color: darken(_palette(bg), 8); text-align: center; .icons { font-size: 1.25em; a { color: _palette(fg-light); &:hover { color: _palette(fg); } } } .copyright { color: _palette(fg-light); font-size: 0.8em; letter-spacing: _size(letter-spacing-alt); list-style: none; padding: 0; text-transform: uppercase; li { border-left: solid 1px _palette(fg-light); display: inline-block; line-height: 1em; margin-left: 1em; padding-left: 1em; &:first-child { border-left: 0; margin-left: 0; padding-left: 0; } a { color: inherit; &:hover { color: _palette(fg); } } @include breakpoint(xsmall) { border: 0; display: block; line-height: 1.65em; margin: 0; padding: 0.5em 0; } } } @include breakpoint(medium) { @include padding(4em, 3em); } @include breakpoint(small) { @include padding(3em, 2em); } } /* Landing */ body.landing { #page-wrapper { @include vendor('background-image', ('linear-gradient(top, rgba(0,0,0,0.5), rgba(0,0,0,0.5))', 'url("#{$baseurl}/banner.jpg")')); background-attachment: fixed; background-position: center center; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-size: cover; padding-top: 0; } #footer { background-color: darken(transparentize(_palette(bg), 0.1), 8); } } body.is-mobile { &.landing { #page-wrapper { background: none; } #banner, .wrapper.style4 { @include vendor('background-image', ('linear-gradient(top, rgba(0,0,0,0.5), rgba(0,0,0,0.5))', 'url("#{$baseurl}/banner.jpg")')); background-position: center center; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-size: cover; } #footer { background-color: darken(_palette(bg), 8); } } }
